title.justification: The title of the paper is "Multi-Objective GFlowNets"

extractions.description: This paper presents Multi-Objective GFlowNets (MOGFNs), a novel method for generating diverse Pareto optimal solutions in multi-objective optimization tasks. MOGFNs leverage Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) to introduce diversity among the generated solutions. The paper introduces two variants of MOGFNs: MOGFN-PC and MOGFN-AL. MOGFN-PC tackles the problem by conditioning on preferences over objectives, while MOGFN-AL integrates an active learning loop for more efficient sample generation. The authors demonstrate the effectiveness of MOGFNs through experiments on various synthetic and benchmark tasks, showing improvements in both Pareto performance and candidate diversity.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments, generates empirical results, and demonstrates the effectiveness of the proposed method through evaluations on various tasks.
type.quote: Our experiments on a wide variety of synthetic and benchmark tasks demonstrate advantages of the proposed methods in terms of the Pareto performance and importantly, improved candidate diversity, which is the main contribution of this work.

name.justification: The primary research field of the paper is Optimization as it deals with multi-objective optimization tasks and generating Pareto optimal solutions.
name.quote: Our experiments on a wide variety of synthetic and benchmark tasks demonstrate advantages of the proposed methods in terms of the Pareto performance and importantly, improved candidate diversity, which is the main contribution of this work.

name.justification: The paper introduces Multi-Objective GFlowNets (MOGFNs), which are based on Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets).
name.quote: We propose Multi-Objective GFlowNets (MOGFNs), a novel method for generating diverse Pareto optimal solutions, based on GFlowNets.

name.justification: The paper leverages concepts from reinforcement learning as seen with Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets), which are a family of probabilistic models.
name.quote: Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) are a recently proposed family of probabilistic models which tackle the problem of diverse candidate generation.

name.justification: One variant of MOGFNs, MOGFN-AL, integrates an active learning loop within the framework of Bayesian optimization.
name.quote: MOGFN-AL leverages the transformation of MOO into a sequence of single objective sub-problems within the framework of multi-objective Bayesian optimization.

name.justification: The main model introduced by the paper is Multi-Objective GFlowNets (MOGFNs).
name.quote: We propose Multi-Objective GFlowNets (MOGFNs), a novel method for generating diverse Pareto optimal solutions, based on GFlowNets.

is_contributed.justification: The paper proposes Multi-Objective GFlowNets (MOGFNs) as a novel contribution.
is_contributed.quote: We propose Multi-Objective GFlowNets (MOGFNs), a novel method for generating diverse Pareto optimal solutions, based on GFlowNets.

is_executed.justification: The model's effectiveness is demonstrated through various experiments, implying its execution.
is_executed.quote: Our experiments on a wide variety of synthetic and benchmark tasks demonstrate advantages of the proposed methods in terms of the Pareto performance and importantly, improved candidate diversity, which is the main contribution of this work.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares MOGFNs numerically to other models.
is_compared.quote: Through experiments on challenging molecule generation and sequence generation tasks, we demonstrate that MOGFN-PC generates diverse Pareto-optimal candidates. This is the first successful application and empirical validation of reward-conditional GFlowNets (Bengio et al., 2021b).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for GFlowNets is "GFlowNet Foundations" by Bengio et al., found in the references section.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets; Bengio et al., 2021a;b) are a recently proposed family of probabilistic models which tackle the problem of diverse candidate generation.

name.justification: MOGFN-PC is a variant of Multi-Objective GFlowNets introduced in the paper, focusing on preference conditioning.
name.quote: We introduce two variants of MOGFNs: MOGFN-PC, which models a family of independent sub-problems defined by a scalarization function, with reward-conditional GFlowNets

is_contributed.justification: MOGFN-PC is introduced as part of the novel contributions by the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We introduce two variants of MOGFNs: MOGFN-PC, which models a family of independent sub-problems defined by a scalarization function, with reward-conditional GFlowNets.

is_executed.justification: The effectiveness of MOGFN-PC is demonstrated through various experiments, suggesting its execution.
is_executed.quote: Through experiments on challenging molecule generation and sequence generation tasks, we demonstrate that MOGFN-PC generates diverse Pareto-optimal candidates.

is_compared.justification: MOGFN-PC is compared to other baseline models in terms of Pareto performance and diversity.
is_compared.quote: Through experiments on challenging molecule generation and sequence generation tasks, we demonstrate that MOGFN-PC generates diverse Pareto-optimal candidates.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for GFlowNets is "GFlowNet Foundations" by Bengio et al., found in the references section.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets; Bengio et al., 2021a;b) are a recently proposed family of probabilistic models which tackle the problem of diverse candidate generation.

name.justification: MOGFN-AL is a variant of Multi-Objective GFlowNets introduced in the paper, focusing on active learning loops.
name.quote: We introduce two variants of MOGFNs: MOGFN-AL, which solves a sequence of sub-problems defined by an acquisition function in an active learning loop.

is_contributed.justification: MOGFN-AL is introduced as part of the novel contributions by the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We introduce two variants of MOGFNs: MOGFN-AL, which solves a sequence of sub-problems defined by an acquisition function in an active learning loop.

is_executed.justification: MOGFN-AL's effectiveness is demonstrated through various experiments, suggesting its execution.
is_executed.quote: In a challenging active learning task for designing fluorescent proteins, we show that MOGFN-AL results in significant improvements to sample efficiency as well as diversity of generated candidates.

is_compared.justification: MOGFN-AL is compared to other baseline models in terms of sample efficiency and candidate diversity.
is_compared.quote: In a challenging active learning task for designing fluorescent proteins, we show that MOGFN-AL results in significant improvements to sample efficiency as well as diversity of generated candidates.

referenced_paper_title.quote: Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets; Bengio et al., 2021a;b) are a recently proposed family of probabilistic models which tackle the problem of diverse candidate generation.

name.justification: The QM9 dataset is used for molecule generation tasks in the experiments.
name.quote: We first consider a small-molecule generation task based on the QM9 dataset (Ramakrishnan et al., 2014).

referenced_paper_title.value: Quantum chemistry structures and properties of 134 kilo molecules
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for QM9 is titled "Quantum chemistry structures and properties of 134 kilo molecules" by Ramakrishnan et al., found in the references section.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We first consider a small-molecule generation task based on the QM9 dataset (Ramakrishnan et al., 2014).

name.justification: RDKit is used for molecular property computation in the experiments.
name.quote: The second reward is the standard Synthetic Accessibility score which we calculate using the RDKit library (Landrum), to get the reward we compute (10 − SA)/9.
